verses.verse: Moreover Job <S%H347><s%> continued <S%H3254><s%> his parable <S%H4912><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%>,
Oh that <S%H5414><s%> I were as in months <S%H3391><s%> past <S%H6924><s%>, as in the days <S%H3117><s%> when God <S%H433><s%> preserved me <S%H8104><s%>;
When his candle <S%H5216><s%> shined <S%H1984><s%> upon my head <S%H7218><s%>, and when by his window <S%H216><s%> I walked <S%H3212><s%> through darkness <S%H2822><s%>;
As I was in the days <S%H3117><s%> of my youth <S%H2779><s%>, when the secret <S%H5475><s%> of God <S%H433><s%> was upon my tabernacle <S%H168><s%>;
When the Almighty <S%H7706><s%> was yet with me <S%H5288><s%>, when my sons were about me <S%H5439><s%>;
When I washed <S%H7364><s%> my steps <S%H1978><s%> with butter <S%H2529><s%>, and the rock <S%H6697><s%> poured me out <S%H6694><s%> rivers <S%H6388><s%> of oil <S%H8081><s%>;
When I went out <S%H3318><s%> to the gate <S%H8179><s%> through the city <S%H7176><s%>, when I prepared <S%H3559><s%> my seat <S%H4186><s%> in the street <S%H7339><s%>!
The young men <S%H5288><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> me <S%H2244><s%>, and hid themselves <S%H3453><s%>: and the aged arose <S%H6965><s%>, and stood up <S%H5975><s%>.
The princes <S%H8269><s%> refrained <S%H6113><s%> talking <S%H4405><s%>, and laid <S%H7760><s%> their hand <S%H3709><s%> on their mouth <S%H6310><s%>.
The nobles <S%H5057><s%> held <S%H2244><s%> their peace <S%H6963><s%>, and their tongue <S%H3956><s%> cleaved <S%H1692><s%> to the roof of their mouth <S%H2441><s%>.
When the ear <S%H241><s%> heard <S%H8085><s%> me <S%H833><s%>, then it blessed me <S%H5869><s%>; and when the eye saw <S%H7200><s%> me <S%H5749><s%>, it gave witness to me:
Because I delivered <S%H4422><s%> the poor <S%H6041><s%> that cried <S%H7768><s%>, and the fatherless <S%H3490><s%>, and him that had none to help him <S%H5826><s%>.
The blessing <S%H1293><s%> of him that was ready to perish <S%H6><s%> came <S%H935><s%> upon me <S%H490><s%>: and I caused the widow's heart <S%H3820><s%> to sing for joy <S%H7442><s%>.
I put <S%H3847><s%> on righteousness <S%H6664><s%>, and it clothed <S%H3847><s%> me <S%H4941><s%>: my judgment was as a robe <S%H4598><s%> and a diadem <S%H6797><s%>.
I was eyes <S%H5869><s%> to the blind <S%H5787><s%>, and feet <S%H7272><s%> was I to the lame <S%H6455><s%>.
I was a father <S%H1><s%> to the poor <S%H34><s%>: and the cause <S%H7379><s%> which I knew <S%H3045><s%> not I searched out <S%H2713><s%>.
And I broke <S%H7665><s%> the jaws <S%H4973><s%> of the wicked <S%H5767><s%>, and plucked <S%H7993><s%> the plunder <S%H2964><s%> out of his teeth <S%H8127><s%>.
Then I said <S%H559><s%>, I shall die <S%H1478><s%> in my nest <S%H7064><s%>, and I shall multiply <S%H7235><s%> my days <S%H3117><s%> as the sand <S%H2344><s%>.
My root <S%H8328><s%> was spread out <S%H6605><s%> by the waters <S%H4325><s%>, and the dew <S%H2919><s%> lay all night <S%H3885><s%> upon my branch <S%H7105><s%>.
My glory <S%H3519><s%> was fresh <S%H2319><s%> in me <S%H5978><s%>, and my bow <S%H7198><s%> was renewed <S%H2498><s%> in my hand <S%H3027><s%>.
Unto me men gave ear <S%H8085><s%>, and waited <S%H3176><s%>, and kept silence <S%H1826><s%> at <S%H3926><s%> my counsel <S%H6098><s%>.
After <S%H310><s%> my words <S%H1697><s%> they spoke not again <S%H8138><s%>; and my speech <S%H4405><s%> dropped upon them <S%H5197><s%>.
And they waited <S%H3176><s%> for me as for the rain <S%H4306><s%>; and they opened <S%H6473><s%> their mouth <S%H6310><s%> wide as for the latter rain <S%H4456><s%>.
If I laughed <S%H7832><s%> on them <S%H539><s%>, they believed it not <S%H216><s%>; and the light of my favor <S%H6440><s%> they cast not down <S%H5307><s%>.

I chose <S%H977><s%> out their way <S%H1870><s%>, and sat <S%H3427><s%> chief <S%H7218><s%>, and lived <S%H7931><s%> as a king <S%H4428><s%> in the army <S%H1416><s%>, as one that comforts <S%H5162><s%> the mourners <S%H57><s%>.
